TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StylusPointCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<valuetype System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint>
Public Class StylusPointCollection Inherits Collection(Of StylusPoint)

Docs.summary: Contains a collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> has a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that contains <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects collected from a stylus and digitizer. You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> to customize the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
## Examples The following example overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.DrawCore%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to draw a circle at each <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> comprising a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. If the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.FitToCurve%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.GetBezierStylusPoints%2A> method returns the stylus points. Otherwise, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints%2A> property returns the stylus points.
[!code-csharp[StrokeSnippets#23](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StrokeSnippets/CSharp/MyStroke.cs#23)] [!code-vb[StrokeSnippets#23](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StrokeSnippets/VisualBasic/MyStroke.vb#23)]

The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

Docs.param: The number of objects the can initially contain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>, you specify it's `initialCapacity`. However, you can add more <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following example collects <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnStylusDown%2A> method of a custom control. The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying both the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.
[!code-csharp[PacketSpy#19](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PacketSpy/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#19)] [!code-vb[PacketSpy#19](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PacketSpy/VisualBasic/Window1.xaml.vb#19)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks All <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects added to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> must have a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that is compatible with `stylusPointDescription`.
## Examples The following example collects <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnStylusDown%2A> method of a custom control. The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> is created with the capacity to hold the specified number of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects. You can add more <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects than `initialCapacity` by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following example collects <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnStylusDown%2A> method of a custom control. The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> by specifying the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> and the initial size of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

## Examples The following example demonstrates how to copy a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>. The example creates a stroke comprised of members of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> and adds them to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>. This example assumes that there is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkcanvs1`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection Reformat(class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription subsetToReformatTo) cil managed
Public Function Reformat (subsetToReformatTo As StylusPointDescription) As StylusPointCollection

Docs.param: A to intersect with the of the current .
Docs.summary: Finds the intersection of the specified and the property.
Docs.returns: A that has a that is a subset of the specified and the that the current uses.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `subsetToReformatTo` is a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> which describes a subset of values belonging to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription.GetCommonDescription%2A> method to get a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that intersects the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> of the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Reformat%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that contains the same <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects as those belonging to the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> uses `subsetToReformatTo` as the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.
> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Reformat%2A> uses the constraints from the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo> of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property, even if the constraints in `subsetToReformatTo` are different. For example, if `subsetToReformatTo` uses the values 0 and 1023 for <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.NormalPressure> whereas <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> uses the values 0 and 255. <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Reformat%2A> returns a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> using the values, 0 and 255.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that uses a different <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.
[!code-csharp[PacketSpy#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PacketSpy/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#17)] [!code-vb[PacketSpy#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PacketSpy/VisualBasic/Window1.xaml.vb#17)]

Docs.exception: is not a subset of the property.
